sourceMeaningMnemonic: If you look at <radical>flowers</radical> the first thing you notice are the leaves and petals themselves, then the <radical>next</radical> thing you notice are the <kanji>briar</kanji>s. You never see <kanji>thorn</kanji>s first, only after you've looked at the flowers.
meaningInfo: Imagine what you see next after looking at the pretty flowers. The briars are what you see next. Spiky and sharp. It would have been nice if you had seen them first.
readingMnemonic: When you see the <kanji>briar</kanji>s you can't help but yell, <reading>Eee! Ba riars</reading>! (<ja>いばら</ja>)! You pause funny because you prick your finger on one while you're yelling. Ouch!
readingInfo: Imagine seeing the briars and yelling out "Ba RI ars!" as you prick your finger on one.
